009package Ch21_Geometric_Operations;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
014import ij.gui.PolygonRoi;
015import ij.gui.Roi;
016import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
017import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.LinearMapping2D;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping2D;
022import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
023import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
024import imagingbook.common.ij.RoiUtils;
025import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
026import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
027import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
028import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
029
030/**
031 * <p>
032 * ImageJ plugin, performs 4-point projective mapping from a selected polygon ROI to the specified paper proportions (A4
033 * or Letter, in portrait format). See Sec. 21.1 (Exercise 21.5 and Fig. 21.17) of [1] for more details.
034 * </p>
035 * <p>
036 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
037 * (2022).
038 * </p>
039 *
040 * @author W. Burger
041 * @version 2022/11/28
042 * @see ProjectiveMapping2D
043 * @see LinearMapping2D
044 * @see ImageMapper
045 */
046public class Rectify_Quad_Selection implements PlugInFilter {
047        
048        private static PaperFormatType PaperFormat = PaperFormatType.A4;
049        private static double OutputPixelSize = 0.5;    // pixel size in mm
050        private static InterpolationMethod IPM = InterpolationMethod.Bilinear;
051        private static boolean ListTransformationMatrix = true;
052        
053        private ImagePlus im = null;
054
055        /**
056         * Constructor, asks to create sample image if no other image is currently open.
057         */
058        public Rectify_Quad_Selection() {
059                if (IjUtils.noCurrentImage() && DialogUtils.askForSampleImage()) {
060                        ImagePlus imp = GeneralSampleImage.PostalPackageSmall.getImagePlus();
061                        float[] xpts = {22, 330, 981, 756};     // manually selected!
062                        float[] ypts = {347, 71, 207, 591};
063                        Roi roi = new PolygonRoi(xpts, ypts, Roi.POLYGON);
064                        imp.setRoi(roi);
065                        imp.show();
066                }
067        }
068        
069        // -----------------------------------------------
070        
071        @Override
072        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus im) {
073                this.im = im;
074                return DOES_ALL + NO_CHANGES + ROI_REQUIRED;
075        }
076
077        @Override
078        public void run(ImageProcessor source) {
079                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
080                if (!(roi instanceof PolygonRoi)) {
081                        IJ.error("Polygon selection required!");
082                        return;
083                }
084                
085                Pnt2d[] sourceCorners = RoiUtils.getOutlinePointsFloat(roi);
086                if (sourceCorners.length < 4) {
087                        IJ.error("At least 4 points must be selected!");
088                        return;
089                }
090                
091                if (!runDialog()) {
092                        return;
093                }
094                
095                double targetWidth = PaperFormat.width;         // in millimeters
096                double targetHeight = PaperFormat.height;
097                                
098                int tWidth  = (int) Math.round(targetWidth  / OutputPixelSize); // pixels
099                int tHeight = (int) Math.round(targetHeight / OutputPixelSize);
100                
101                Pnt2d[] targetCorners = {
102                                PntInt.from(0, 0),
103                                PntInt.from(tWidth, 0),
104                                PntInt.from(tWidth, tHeight),
105                                PntInt.from(0, tHeight)};
106                
107                LinearMapping2D mp = // inverse mapping (target to source)
108                                ProjectiveMapping2D.fromPoints(sourceCorners, targetCorners).getInverse();      
109
110                if (ListTransformationMatrix) {
111                        PrintPrecision.set(6);
112                        IJ.log("Inverse transformation (target to source): M = \n" + mp.toString());
113                }
114        
115                ImageProcessor target = source.createProcessor(tWidth, tHeight);
116                ImageMapper mapper = new ImageMapper(mp, null, IPM);
117                mapper.map(source, target);
118                new ImagePlus("target", target).show();
119        }
120        
121        // --------------------------------------------
122        
123        enum PaperFormatType {
124                A4(210, 297),
125                Letter(216, 279);
126                
127                final double width, height;             // paper dimensions in mm
128                
129                PaperFormatType(double width, double height) {
130                        this.width = width;
131                        this.height = height;
132                }
133        }
134        
135        // --------------------------------------------
136        
137        private boolean runDialog() {
138                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
139                gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
140                                "How to use: Select the four corners of the quad to be rectified",
141                                "with a polygon ROI, in clockwise direction, starting at the point",
142                                "that should map to the top-left corner (in portrait mode).",
143                                "Note that only the first 4 points are used!"));
144                
145                gd.addEnumChoice("Output paper format", PaperFormat);
146                gd.addNumericField("Output pixel size (mm)", OutputPixelSize, 2);
147                gd.addEnumChoice("Pixel interpolation method", IPM);
148                gd.addCheckbox("List transformation matrix", ListTransformationMatrix);
149                
150                gd.showDialog();
151                if (gd.wasCanceled())
152                        return false;
153        
154                PaperFormat = gd.getNextEnumChoice(PaperFormatType.class);
155                OutputPixelSize = gd.getNextNumber();
156                IPM = gd.getNextEnumChoice(InterpolationMethod.class);
157                ListTransformationMatrix = gd.getNextBoolean();
158                
159                return true;
160        }
161        
162}
